archiefmat.titel: Archief van het Kabinet des Konings (1814) 1841-1897
archiefmat.notes:
A first finding aid for the ‘Verbaalarchief’ of the King’s Secretariat are the so-called ‘hoofdenlijsten’, lists of topics (nos. 4023-4058, period 1841-1870). Examples of relevant topics are ‘West-Indische Zaken’ (West Indian affairs) and ‘Slavenhandel’ (slave trade). The specified page numbers refer to the indices of the files, nos. 3843-3919, period 1841-1870. The inv.nos. of the files – laws, Royal Decrees and letters of the Secretariat - are 1-1879, period 1841-1870.

A similar search is possible in the second part of this archive, the secret files. A first finding aid is provided by the indices (nos. 4310-4333, period 1841-1873). Examples of relevant keywords are ‘Koloniën’ (Colonies) and ‘Slavenhandel’ (slave trade). The specified letters and numbers refer to the secret files – secret Royal Decrees and letters of the Secretariat - nos. 4133-4274, period 1841-1870.

See also F.J.M. Otten, "Gids voor de archieven van de ministeries en de Hoge Colleges van Staat" (Den Haag 2004), pp. 77-100.
